subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 05 July, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Blades secure date at High Court
Sheffield United will appeal to the High Court over the Carlos Tevez affair.



 
Villa complete Reo-Coker signing
Aston Villa sign West Ham midfielder Nigel Reo-Coker for £8.5m.



 
Man Utd close in on striker Tevez
West Ham striker Carlos Tevez is set to join Manchester United, BBC sports editor Mihir Bose understands.








GOLF




European Open leaderboard
Four of Europe's Ryder Cup winners are back at the K Club this week, as is US Open champion Angel Cabrera.



 
Howell relieved with Tour return
David Howell believes his career plans have been heavily dented by his two-month lay-off with back and wrist problems.



 
Clarke caddie cool on Tiger link
Darren Clarke's caddie Billy Foster insists he has not been approached to work with world number one Tiger Woods next season.








MOTORSPORT




Spy row will not damage Hamilton
F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone says Lewis Hamilton will not be penalised whatever happens in the McLaren-Ferrari spy row.



 
McLaren caught in Ferrari spy row
McLaren suspend a senior designer after rivals Ferrari say they have proof he received technical information from the Italian team.



 
Tyres 'helping Hamilton to shine'
Red Bull driver Mark Webber says Lewis Hamilton's stunning season has been aided by other drivers struggling with Formula One's new tyres.








FORMULA ONE




Spy row will not damage Hamilton
F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone says Lewis Hamilton will not be penalised whatever happens in the McLaren-Ferrari spy row.



 
McLaren caught in Ferrari spy row
McLaren suspend a senior designer after rivals Ferrari say they have proof he received technical information from the Italian team.



 
Tyres 'helping Hamilton to shine'
Red Bull driver Mark Webber says Lewis Hamilton's stunning season has been aided by other drivers struggling with Formula One's new tyres.








ATHLETICS




Benjamin is edged out in Zagreb
Britain's Tim Benjamin is beaten into second by world indoor 400m champion Alleyne Francique at the Zagreb Grand Prix, but Tim Abeyie wins the 200m.



 
Kluft set to make UK outdoor bow
Carolina Kluft will make her first outdoor appearance in the UK when she competes at the British Grand Prix next week.



 
Devonish edged out in Athens 100m
Britain's Marlon Devonish comes second behind Derrick Atkins of the Bahamas in the men's 100m at the Athens Grand Prix.








CYCLING




Petacchi to miss Tour de France
Alessandro Petacchi will miss the Tour de France after the Italian Olympic Committee charges him with doping.



 
Millar fears for cycling's future
Britain's David Millar says cycling is in a "complete mess" and will continue to be haunted by drug scandals.



 
Riis to stay away from 2007 Tour
Disgraced Team CSC manager Bjarne Riis will not attend this year's Tour de France.








FUN AND GAMES




Rain on Spain
Robbo sympathises with Rafael Nadal and applauds the ladies players



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport



 
Quotes of the Week
Freddie Flintoff is likened to a toddler and the stars hit out at Wimbledon
